page.title: 15CHURCHES IN SEASCALE
page.content: Seascale is mainly a Church of England village,but there are also people who are Methodists,or Roman Catholics or Jehovah's Witnesses.The Roman Catholic Priest comes to our school once a week to conduct a Catholic service. The two boys who are Jehovah's Witnesses don't have a service at school. The Church of England is called St.Cuthberts.It was built in 1894 when the corrugated iron church blew down. There is a Methodist church and a Roman Catholic church.Most people go to the Church of England on Sunday. The Guides have a Church Parade once a fortnight at the two Protestant churches.There are two services on Sunday,and a Sunday school for children at St.Cuthberts and the Chapel.
